column5: Hi all,  Went to try for some bass and lakers in a small local lake, we had never fished this lake before so decided to try for bass first so we could at least work out the depths of the shoreline water as we cast our lines around and see if we could locate baitfish, suspended fish on the sonar.  Well....we never got round to catching any trout, we did not even try actually, the bass fishing was so good from the 3rd cast onwards. We were both using gulp 3" minnows on a jig and landed well over 40 smallmouth in 3hrs, nothing over 18" but a blast none the less.   ONE OF THE BESTEST DAYS BASSIN I'VE HAD ...EVER!  <object width="640" height="385"><param name="movie" value="
Great vid. You certainly got yourself a slice of paradise up there. Wouldn't mind seeing a vid of the trout being caught.
awesome vid Simon way to go gotta love when the bass hit like that  Rick

Thanks JB...like i said we never really tried for trout in the end, we gave it a token effort of half an hour, but the high winds (gusting to 45kmh) anywhere else on the lake apart from the shore we were on made it difficult to go exploring.    Thanks Rick....thought you might like that one. good job on the walleye the other day whilst soaking for trout...maybe this year we'll get out...lol...we say it every year but never do...lol.

Killing me.  Absolutely killing me.  I'll be just of east of Winnipeg next weekend but won't get a chance to hit the river and then I have to wait until August to fish NWO again.  Thanks for constantly reminding me of what I left behind Simon
OMG I can't wait to start bass fishing   Awesome video and catches!  Thanks for sharing, MTBF
You may not be able to find the crappie but you sure have the bass dialed in. Well done.
Great video Simon!  40 smallies in 3hrs is Amazing.  Well done
Great video and lots of nice fish!  That gets me pumped for opener down here  Paul
I'm dying to get into some bass! Love your videos!
3 hours, a very busy 3 hours. nice work. enjoyed the tease thanks.
Got to love steady action Simon     You guys certainly hit he basspot Great report and video as always Thanks for sharing Jacques
